result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph F. Anderlik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.
The defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called @ 3:15 p.m. Defendant Joseph F. Anderlik in court with attorney Robert J. Vander Loop.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 1 & 2 - DRI. 14TR49 - DRI. Statement by the defendant. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 3 days CFTS - Sentence to commence no later than 5/1/2014, costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Joseph F. Anderlik in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant will be represented by SPD upon verification of some assets the defendant may have. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting lower cash bond or a signature bond. Court orders $750 cash bond w/ conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
